subject: p13352405
Findings: The three chest tubes are now on waterseal. The appearance of the right hemithorax, including the clips and soft tissue collection of air is unchanged as compared to the previous examination. There is increased gas filling of colon interposed between the chest wall and the liver. No current evidence of pneumothorax. Unchanged normal appearance of the cardiac silhouette and of the left lung. No other changes.
